normalised: Hey everyone! Thinking of investing in a new property in Mumbai or Bangalore? Then builder reviews are your best friend, trust me!

unnormalised: Hey everyone! Thinking of investing in a new property in Mumbai or Bangalore? Then builder reviews are your best friend, trust me!
normalised: It's like checking I M D B ratings before watching a Bollywood flick – you wouldn't just blindly go see anything, right? Similarly, before putting your hard-earned rupees on the line, see what others are saying about the builder.

unnormalised: It's like checking IMDb ratings before watching a Bollywood flick – you wouldn't just blindly go see anything, right? Similarly, before putting your hard-earned Rs. on the line, see what others are saying about the builder.
normalised: Seriously, do your homework! Check online forums, housing groups on Facebook (especially the ones specific to your locality, like "Residents of H S R Layout"), and even talk to people you know who might have bought from the same builder.

unnormalised: Seriously, do your homework! Check online forums, housing groups on Facebook (especially the ones specific to your locality, like "Residents of HSR Layout"), and even talk to people you know who might have bought from the same builder.
normalised: Look beyond the glossy brochures and fancy ads. Are there consistent complaints about construction quality? Are there delays in possession (very common, unfortunately)? Does the builder actually deliver on promises like the promised amenities (gym, swimming pool, etcetera)?

unnormalised: Look beyond the glossy brochures and fancy ads. Are there consistent complaints about construction quality? Are there delays in possession (very common, unfortunately)? Does the builder actually deliver on promises like the promised amenities (gym, swimming pool, etc.)?
normalised: I've heard horror stories of folks buying 'dream homes' near I I T Bombay, only to find out later that the water supply is erratic or the building has structural issues.

unnormalised: I've heard horror stories of folks buying 'dream homes' near IIT Bombay, only to find out later that the water supply is erratic or the building has structural issues.
normalised: Read through the fine print in your agreement carefully. Better yet, get a lawyer friend (like my cousin, Priya) to give it a once-over.

unnormalised: Read through the fine print in your agreement *carefully*. Better yet, get a lawyer friend (like my cousin, Priya) to give it a once-over.
normalised: Think of it like this: Choosing the right builder is as crucial as choosing the right pandit for your griha pravesh ceremony! Don't take it lightly.
